metadata.title: CVE-2023-1077 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, pick_next_rt_entity() may return a type confusedentry, not detected by the BUG_ON condition, as the confused entry will notbe NULL, but list_head.The buggy error condition would lead to a typeconfused entry with the list head,which would then be used as a typeconfused sched_rt_entity,causing memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1077` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-152.169~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1104.112~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1110.116~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1107.116~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1051.56~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1103.112~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1088-raspi - 5.4.0-1088.99~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
